item.title: Ongoing Neglect of Elmfield Avenue and Elmfield Street, 12th November
item.description:
I’ve been reporting the same issue for two years now, and it’s clear that giving more time won’t change anything. As shown in the attached photos, the street has been in poor condition since at least 2009 — something that can easily be verified through Google Maps imagery — although it’s very likely it has been this way for even longer. Sixteen years is quite unacceptable. Last year, after numerous complaints on this platform (more than ten), a small section of the street was finally repaired. However, both Elmfield Avenue and Elmfield Street remain in a severe state of neglect. There are potholes throughout, growing larger each time, and in this year’s 2025 photo — next to the maroon car — you can clearly see that the ground is sinking, creating a large puddle every time it rains. The pavements are also in very poor condition: cracked, uneven, and full of holes. I intend to continue reporting these issues regularly until appropriate maintenance work is carried out. Sixteen years without proper repairs is more than enough.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Elmfield Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: Drains blocked yet again., 12th November
item.description:
This time the water is so high it is over the footpath and children are having to walk through it on their way into school. The leaves which were along the edge of the road are no longer there. My suspicion is that the leaves have not been cleared away but have been washed into the drains causing the blockage. Council, please don't email me asking if the problem has gone away on its own this time, just get a truck out asap. It also might be cheaper for you to send a road sweeper out frequently during leaf fall rather than the drain cleaner, just a suggestion.

item.title: Huge potholes over 80mm deep in front of Beverston House on Leckhamtpon Lane, 12th November
item.description:

I was surprised to see how big the pothole in road was, very dangerous. I've took photos and a video as well and moved on slowly with hazard lights to the next layby. My car now is off road as is not driveable, not sure yet what is the issue, but I will take it to a garage today. I assume i something to do with the steering... The potholes are in front of Beverston House, The house next to Greylands, and they are about 500mm by 500mm wide and over 80mm deep.

item.title: No street light in Vernon Place, in front of RA Bennet office, 11th November
item.description:
The street lights on Vernon Place have not been functioning for quite some time now. We moved here in September, and since then, we’ve noticed that the lane remains completely dark at night. Earlier, it wasn’t much of an issue because it stayed light until later in the evening, but now it gets dark around 4–5 p.m., making the whole lane 'pitch black'. It feels quite uncomfortable and even a bit fearful to walk through at night. The darkness also encourages unpleasant behaviour, especially over weekends, when people coming out of the nearby Wetherspoon often gather here to smoke, drink, shout, and sometimes urinate on the walls. It’s hardly visible because of how dark it is, but for residents, it feels very unpleasant. Proper lighting would really help improve the safety, comfort, and cleanliness of the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Vernon Place, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.title: Birdlip House leaking water on to the road, 11th November
item.description:
Dear Gloucestershire Highways, This is the same issue that we had last winter which led to large icy patches on the road close to the school. A significant amount of water is running out of the driveway of Birdlip house then down the Cirencester Road, making it very wet. Last winter when it was below freezing point this same issue caused large areas of the road to become covered in ice. The most significant icy area is in the national speed limit area next to the "chicane" on the exit from the main part of Birdlip village towards Parson's Pitch. When the temperature goes below freezing this will be very dangerous again this year, we need to get the leak at Birdlip House fixed for good. I appreciate this might not be your jurisdiction but you do have significant influence to bear and can if necessary involve other authorities.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Birdlip, Gloucester
